message.content:
1. Hide and Seek - a classic game where one person hides while the others try to find them.

2. Duck, Duck, Goose - children sit in a circle while one child walks around tapping each on the head, saying "Duck!" until they eventually say "Goose!", initiating a chase as the chosen "goose" tries to catch the original tapper before taking their spot in the circle.

3. Red Rover – two teams line up facing each other with locked arms; members take turns shouting “Red rover, red rover, send [player's name] right over!” The designated player then attempts to break through the opposing team’s chain of locked arms.

4. Tag or Freeze Tag – players run and try to avoid being tagged by whoever is "it,"; those tagged become frozen (unable to move) until another player unfreezes them by tagging again.

5. Relay races - can involve different challenges such as running with an egg on a spoon or putting on oversized clothing during each lap

6. Capture The Flag – two teams compete trying to steal each other's flag from opposite ends of playing area without being caught/tagged by opponents

7. Simon Says - follow directions if prefaced with 'Simon says'; ignore otherwise

8.The Floor Is Lava – pretend that any surface other than predetermined ones (e.g., furniture cushions) are lava so participants must stay off actual floor

9.Hopscotch- draw squares/rectangles using chalk outside; toss small object across blocks & hop across skipping designated square/block where objects have landed

10.Musical Chairs / Statues: need music source for both games meaning participant cannot be touching chair when music stops
